{{Wireless embedded system |brand=Celeno |model=VXT1836 |revision= |upc= |ean= |asin= |price= |est_release_date= |fcc_date=05/10/2013 |manuf_country= |manuf=Zinwell |manuf_model=ZW-N5000 |manuf_rev= |availability= |type=access point, station |fcc_id=Y7E-VXT1836000001 |ic_id= |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_barrel_inner= |pwr_barrel_outer= |pwr_barrel_len= |pwr_vac= |pwr_ac_hz= |pwr_pol= |pwr_poe= |cpu1_brand=Celeno-Ralink |cpu1_model=CL1830 |cpu1_cspeed= |cpu2_brand= |cpu2_model= |cpu2_cspeed= |fla1=8 |fla1_brand=Macronix |fla1_model=MX29LV640EBTI-70G |fla1_num= |fla2= |fla2_brand= |fla2_model= |fla2_num= |ram1=64 |ram1_brand=Nanya |ram1_model=NT5TU32M16CG-25C |ram1_num= |ram2= |ram2_brand= |ram2_model= |ram2_num= |expansion_if_types= |expansion_pcmcia_num= |expansion_expresscard_num= |expansion_minipci_num= |expansion_minipcie_num= |expansion_usb_num= |jtag= |serial= |wi1_module= |wi1_module_if= |wi1_chip1_brand=Celeno-Ralink |wi1_chip1_model=CL1830 |wi1_chip2_brand= |wi1_chip2_model= |wi1_chip3_brand= |wi1_chip3_model= |wi1_802dot11_protocols=an |wi1_ant_conn= |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_module= |wi2_module_if= |wi2_chip1_brand= |wi2_chip1_model= |wi2_chip2_brand= |wi2_chip2_model= |wi2_chip3_brand= |wi2_chip3_model= |wi2_802dot11_protocols= |wi2_ant_conn= |wi2_txchains= |wi2_rxchains= |wi2_sstreams= |eth_none= |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip1_brand= |eth_chip1_model= |eth_chip2_brand=IC+ |eth_chip2_model=IP101A |eth_chip3_brand=IC+ |eth_chip3_model=IP101A |sw_cpu= |sw_brand= |sw_model= |lan_speed=100M |lan_ports=2 |wan_ports= |flags= |tp_firmware= |802dot11_protocols=an |default_ssid= |default_ssid_regex= |default_ip= |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui= |oui_eth= }} '''VXT1836 Wireless Video Extender Kit''' - '''Video Bridge Unit'''
"ZW-N5000 Ver:05" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. :The device appears to be using three [http://www.skyworksinc.com/Product.aspx?ProductID=973 '''Skyworks''' ('''SiGe''') SE5012T / 5012T 5GHz FEMs].
Per the FCC manual... *The default credentials are admin:admin *In AP mode.. **Default IP of 10.0.0.2 (w/ 255.0.0.0 Net Mask) <!-- -->{{#subobject:AP mode|Default IP address=10.0.0.2}}<!-- -->*In STA mode.. **Default IP of 10.0.0.10 (w/ 255.0.0.0 Net Mask)<!-- -->{{#subobject:STA mode|Default IP address=10.0.0.10}}<!-- -->*The default SSID pattern shown as an example is '''VXT1800''''''''XXXXXX''''' **'''''XXXXXX''''' is the last three octets of the BSSID (upper case letters) **There are a fair number of hits for this pattern on WiGLE (93 w/ 80:1F:02 ['''Edimax'''] OUIs) **The actual SSID pattern may be '''VXT1836''''''''XXXXXX'''''
